How can I use JSON RPC to interact with Verus?

You can use JSON RPC to interact with Verus by sending a JSON-formatted request to the Verus server. The request should include the JSON RPC version, a unique ID for the request, the method you want to call, and any necessary parameters.

As json rpc
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getvdxfid", "params": ["idname::userdefinedgroup.subgroup.publishedname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What is the format of a JSON RPC request to Verus?

A JSON RPC request to Verus should be in the following format:
```
{
  "jsonrpc": "1.0",
  "id": "unique_request_id",
  "method": "method_name",
  "params": ["parameter1", "parameter2",...]
}
```

As json rpc
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getvdxfid", "params": ["idname::userdefinedgroup.subgroup.publishedname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
How can I use `curl` to send a JSON RPC request to Verus?

You can use `curl` to send a JSON RPC request to Verus by specifying the JSON data as a binary string, setting the content type to `text/plain`, and providing the Verus server URL. Here's an example:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getvdxfid", "params": ["idname::userdefinedgroup.subgroup.publishedname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```

As json rpc
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getvdxfid", "params": ["idname::userdefinedgroup.subgroup.publishedname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
